abstract_summ: One year after the diagnosis, the patient experienced recurrence with a left supraclavicular lymph node metastasis, which was surgically removed, followed by standard cisplatin-etoposide chemotherapy.Because his performance status(PS)was 1, he underwent 4 courses ofnab -paclitaxel(nab-PTX)plus carboplatin( CBDCA)plus pembrolizumab chemotherapy and pembrolizumab maintenance chemotherapy.Postop- eratively, the patient received combined S-1/trastuzumab chemotherapy toward the end of January 2014.We describe a 62-year-old patient who underwent pancreaticoduodenectomy for a NEC located in the pancreatic head, with peripancreatic lymph node metastases.Chest computed tomography(CT)revealed stenosis ofthe right main bronchus, and pathological diagnosis ofthe lesion was squamous cell carcinoma and PD-L1 expression was low(tumor proportion score [TPS]: 1%).
title_summ: Long Survival and Prolonged Remission after Surgery and Chemotherapy in a Metastatic Mismatch Repair Deficient Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Carcinoma with MLH1/PMS2 Immunodeficiency and Minimal Microsatellite Shift.[A Case of Squamous Cell Lung Cancer in an Elderly Patient with Low PD-L1 Expression Effectively Treated with Nab-Paclitaxel(Nab-PTX)plus Carboplatin (CBDCA)plus Pembrolizumab for a Recurrence after Operation].[Complete Response of Liver Metastases from a HER2-Positive Gastric Cancer Treated with Combined S-1/Trastuzumab Chemotherapy].
title_abstract_phrases: Long Survival and Prolonged Remission after Surgery and Chemotherapy in a Metastatic Mismatch Repair Deficient Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Carcinoma with MLH1/PMS2 Immunodeficiency and Minimal Microsatellite Shift.Chemotherapy using nab-PTX plus CBDCA plus pembrolizumab may become one of the therapeutic choices for the recurrence after operation of an elderly person with squamous cell lung carcinoma and low PD-L1 expression.[Complete Response of Liver Metastases from a HER2-Positive Gastric Cancer Treated with Combined S-1/Trastuzumab Chemotherapy].A 74-year-old man with upper abdominal pain and anorexia was referred to our hospital in December 2013.Because his performance status(PS)was 1, he underwent 4 courses ofnab -paclitaxel(nab-PTX)plus carboplatin( CBDCA)plus pembrolizumab chemotherapy and pembrolizumab maintenance chemotherapy.Chest computed tomography(CT)revealed stenosis ofthe right main bronchus, and pathological diagnosis ofthe lesion was squamous cell carcinoma and PD-L1 expression was low(tumor proportion score [TPS]: 1%).Postop- eratively, the patient received combined S-1/trastuzumab chemotherapy toward the end of January 2014.
